document.title: CTE Model Curriculum Standards: Information and Communication Technologies

9ADFE347EE37483ABB5204861287630D.description: Create intelligently designed games that would educate as well as engage the players.

966FFE65622D41589A5B1C01E4EA6B7B.description: Use AI techniques, like finite state machines, to produce the illusion of intelligence in the behavior of nonplayer characters (NPCs).

90582001AE28477AB9E88FBC3863290C.description: Design, program, and implement intelligent agents for action games.

95E0B86423694CB3A19BFFBCBD66768F.description: Describe AI and how it relates to game and simulation design and development.

8C575D0E2B3A42FC9676935D1CBE15C3.description: Acquire and apply appropriate artificial intelligence (AI) techniques used by the game development industry.

F3701FC24B244C27A13ECF25E0E2F213.description: Create and maintain documentation and perform program maintenance.

461733553B224CAE822991756F7D426F.description: Plan program design and evaluate assigned game programming tasks.

132C6467AC224AA4BE6D40A0DA6D7C97.description: Identify functions of information processing and describe basic network terminology and network security and demonstrate an understanding of operating systems, environments, and platforms.

E97537643B30477680D057D67E748B8F.description: Acquire and apply appropriate programming skills for rendering a single player or multiuser game or simulation project, including program control, conditional branching, memory management, scorekeeping, timed event strategies, and implementation issues.

9C1807DC609542A7911B145770E6A3C2.description: Understand the use of inventory systems in game design.

29A83CD7A7DE4AA3B176AD7965BEEBDC.description: Apply the "eight golden rules" of interface design.

DDC0E0B775554E6796828C01C3214730.description: Identify and describe the basic Human Computer Interface (HCI) design principles.

51880450DE3F40568DC7CFCB38EFE4C0.description: Describe applied event modeling as it relates to game design.

D10049D5CA4744FD9F2FC68F561E0E40.description: Define the meaning of simulation and pertinent issues facing game designers.

F226E6DA65E94CD699F67BC33619ACE2.description: Explain the role and principles of event modeling and interface design and apply those principles in a game/simulation design and project.

C3C0B5E610ED48B9A170FC310662F767.description: Describe how environmental design is used in conjunction with game level design.

E441F872190C41EDAB9A81C6C758787C.description: Understand the general concepts of environmental design.

B935238D2F214C488EB193808FE076B8.description: I rolled my eyes so hard they may be permanently lodged at the back of my skull.

1A12757DE29E409C95EDB6360259F286.description: Understand the methodologies for integrating digital media into a game or simulation.

323E29B8958E46FEAEBFDC7B18018ECD.description: Integrate music, sound, art, and animation as it applies to the environmental design of the game/simulation.

A97421E1810E4BCDAB8CE3E66CCBF3EF.description: Describe rule creation elements of player challenge.

308CA7E6BE1B40B3B7B002F984F5898F.description: Assess common principles and procedures in game flow design.

FC353DC67A38469B9C27359FE2CA5C3C.description: Create and design the game flow as it relates to story and plot.

586652C7FEB74C13A483C445A0D09197.description: Understand the process of creating and designing player actions.

A8C1389DCE69402684D3FAF2755A06A0.description: Use key strategic considerations in game design.

68E7D2FBCA504391B46B32FAD2C7EDB5.description: Understand strategic outlining in game designs.

E28AEAFBBED74086B1C2EC51310A7F93.description: Identify, describe, and implement standard game/simulation strategy and rules of play.

641FCDBF3F1E4FFE9E4186417A02E419.description: Using simple game development tools, create a game or simulation.

D8DEE8C8FA744EB8BCCD5E057DCF076A.description: Create a design specification document to include interface and delivery choices, rules of play, navigation functionality, scoring, media choices, start and end of play, special features, and development team credits.

9873595167314E0BB7DD1B87779B16DD.description: Create a storyboard describing the essential elements, plot, flow, and functions of the game/simulation.

411F31C8723C4A5C94FB1919C235D25C.description: Create a working game or simulation individually or as part of a team.

A24D18E3CB1547C49ADB169C13BBB123.description: Make informed decisions about game physics: how the game world works, how the players interact with the game world, and how the players interact with one another

6D45BCFDD10140ED898F21C9CF687B21.description: Demonstrate an understanding of interface design, hardware constraints on games, including processors and I/O devices, and nonhardware constraints.

AE438CD48CA148ADAE40A8DCDE0C936A.description: Experience the methods used to create and sustain player immersion.

55E6A47E66EB4F2BB232DAB7DB36EE5B.description: Describe the complex interaction between games and players and the role it plays in the popularity of a game.

F3139F20A895440A893250B59A8E1388.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the techniques used to evaluate game mechanics, game play, flow, and game design.

D7F7702ABC4F4FFCB301D8240500626D.description: Know how to use tools and software commonly used in game/simulation development and become familiar with popular game tools and different gaming engines.

76EC35FF6AC24646B5E98E5FE10CCCD2.description: Understand the general principles of storytelling and the use of storyboarding in game design.

FBAFFAE943F4443F946549DF0BFE67BA.description: Develop a game design document or blueprint.

219D18418161467BA10EA3D263E07DB4.description: Describe the game development life cycle.

9CAF66452EF344359596A85BDF0668A3.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the vocabulary for discussing games and play by listing and describing the general procedure and requirements of game and simulation design.

DFD2AF676B9B4E908A33C9A28604E1A5.description: Demonstrate an understanding of game and simulation analysis, design, standard documentation, and development tools.

5442A1E2334042E7ADFD2E7152F07577.description: Describe the impact of the game and simulation industry on the economy.

34BEECE305B64A5E89F08F8FAC910D8A.description: Describe legal issues that affect games, developers and players.

D7AF9B3D3A5041208FFA9C406C879AF9.description: Identify the core tasks and challenges that face a game or simulation design team.

998CE47B3CF34719B4B626AE15B4DC81.description: Examine and categorize the significant processes in the production of interactive games.

7270870440AD422CA39C7EBCCA23CA9C.description: Describe the business model commonly used in the game development industry.

FB05E24D76E840BCA5FBFFF2B5F77168.description: Describe the psychological impact of games on individuals and groups.

3DB88E4161BE4D6E9CA64C0584B63525.description: Describe the role of play in human culture.

1BBE933AA11B4D1A8D9D0CEDDC288D3F.description: Describe the historical significance of electronic and nonelectronic games.

D4758B4AA70145DF8F223D25E7F4DC4C.description: Categorize the different gaming genres and gaming systems.

A9C911CAA8F14E589EA23DFDF55A091C.description: Identify and describe critical game and simulation studies, the resulting societal impact, and the management, industry, and career requirements.

comments: Students in the Game and Simulation pathway learn relevant technical knowledge and skills to prepare for further education and careers such as Game/Simulation Designer, Game Programmer, and Game Software Developer. Game and simulation design requires that students have a solid foundational understanding of game design, hardware, graphics, and animation. Persons with expertise in game and simulation design have had practical experiences in game/simulation conceptualization, design, storyboarding, development methodologies, essential programming techniques, working with a team, and implementation issues.

9279E99F3FDB4617B5A5C9E8A803426C.description: Implement artificial intelligent behavior through various methods: mathematical modeling, reinforcement learning, and probabilistic analysis.

FE73E90EA6CE4BED971BBDE00817E334.description: Know artificial intelligence methods such as neural networks, Bayesian inferences, fuzzy logic, and finite state machines.

88ED1BBE4F0B4F64B6A78F26A0807D47.description: Describe the major areas of intelligent computing, including perception, proximity, processing, and control.

E55F95CB4F47441494DFF95131EBB361.description: Describe models of intelligent behavior and what distinguishes humans from machines.

0091403A0A7C420DBB527C863A2DC2D9.description: Program a micro-controller for a device or robot.

64F66A02CA1D4A76808318BC28E17FE9.description: Apply the concepts of embedded programming, including digital logic, machine-level representation of data, and memory-system organization.

5433AACEDE7E490C98970D2538B3B84F.description: Use hardware to gain input, process information, and take action.

9CDFA9DEE71C4134915FFCB5FD1EE786.description: Install equipment, assemble hardware, and perform tests using appropriate tools and technology.

25AEA4C5C779435EB3C21EC8C1C203D0.description: Demonstrate awareness of the applications of device development work, including personalized computing, robotics, and smart appliances.

2679BDE69D9548CA93A4AD40C3758A92.description: Develop software for a variety of devices, including robotics.

1BD9BFFE8C5249A5BDD6A7377F9C11FD.description: Analyze and display data to assist with decision making using methods like cross tabulations, graphs, and charts.

D6948E9ECCC84086B0911B8426E8D92C.description: Export and import data to and from other applications and a database recognizing the limitations and challenges inherent in the process.

B23027725155462EA051F096FED6BCAD.description: Develop databases that are properly normalized using appropriate schemas.

05C8F6DEF87A442CB8BC053C701BC911.description: Use queries to extract and manipulate data (select queries, action queries).

B4C5D60AB5E145BCAF1019C2CFB4E7CD.description: Use data modeling techniques to create databases based upon business needs.

7004E30F8310498A9A7ACBC0253F9BDD.description: Identify and explain the types of relationships between tables (one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-many) and use methods to establish these relationships, including primary keys, foreign keys, and indexes.

4DBFDE2A1ABC40C09A01E5852E4F9FED.description: Identify and use the basic structures of databases, fields, records, tables, and views.

A5A9D9F8734D4E55A63A28EC4DD220F4.description: Describe the critical function of databases in modern organizations.

E2A9CC244B6A40058F780AD6B272117E.description: Optimize fast delivery and retrieval of online content such as Web pages.

CB8B6EFCD2EA433B8C656DDE53206838.description: Create an online project, Web-based business, and e-portfolio.

E60CCBAC6CDD44C6839A94C201843708.description: Enable e-commerce capabilities to sell products, create a shopping cart, and handle credit card transactions.

E54309B36A4F41B29DD6459FBC3D9F44.description: Attract Web-site visitors through search engine optimization using various strategies like keywords and meta-tags.

64D03AF5BEB0479F97634A89661C9436.description: Describe the full process of online content delivery, registering domain names, setting up hosting, and setting up e-mail addresses.

B0D54F9573214393988936FF1FEAF68C.description: Identify the hardware (server) and software required for Web hosting and other services.

F0CE4F72C5B8423AA4E23498CEAE04AB.description: Create and/or capture professional-quality media, images, documents, audio, and video clips.

AFAEFA8731984A3AA1E9A3A690DFB8AE.description: Integrate media into a full project using appropriate tools.

B138678904B6487AB267CE0C622F4878.description: Analyze the use of media to determine the appropriate file format and level of compression.

61E7E59C2BA94BCB9BFEB6F42E40EB4E.description: Use media design and editing software: keyframe animation, drawing software, image editors, and three-dimensional design.

5D246E34A7D34ECB993BBFBC27CB1968.description: Describe the various encoding methods of media and trade-offs: vector graphics vs. bitmaps, and bit depth.

89CF9AD99E7248D2A1CB231EDCBD2121.description: Identify the basic design elements necessary to produce effective print, video, audio, and interactive media.

9A29381D77E14F1D882E6313BE1DEB38.description: Use strategies to optimize code for improved performance.

6AD649243E69488BA0041B30419E5DDF.description: Test, debug, and improve software development work.

E0E185CDEAF84908A643F228ED9852FF.description: Create programs using control structures, procedures, functions, parameters, variables, error recovery, and recursion.

6E8B221ED7BB4A7A8C123A08302B419E.description: Use object oriented programming concepts, properties, methods, and inheritance.

3784415F155840EC9D3C9D67C3C609C9.description: Use various data structures, arrays, objects, files, and databases.

9EDCDE4DDC5B4A899E203CF703C0B2D7.description: Demonstrate awareness of various programming paradigms, including procedural, object oriented, event-driven, and multithreaded programing.

D25FCA211E15488C9B9BA0DE93173C45.description: Identify and apply data types and encoding.

3728759049654351953A4C0C8EC35A96.description: Identify and use different authoring tools and integrated development environments (IDEs).

BBACEEE881284635836A8C83F56B282F.description: Describe the interaction and integration of programming languages and protocols such as how client-side programming can work with server-side programming to use a query language to access a database.

3939817986F1453499EAAF4A3B4AB682.description: Identify and describe the abstraction level of programming languages from low-level, hardware-based languages to high-level, interpreted, Web-based languages.

E7BC9210600F43D4BEA5110886786791.description: Support methods of accessibility for all potential users, including users with disabilities and non-English-speaking users.

CA87B8D3D6E64F3CBF818AB32A4D1094.description: Design effective and intuitive interfaces using knowledge of cognitive, physical, and social interactions.

F8ED85A2B1774515A5BF550BACA57578.description: Describe and apply the basic process of input, processing, and output.

DF3C954C69694155B2BF9D3A29D0EF23.description: Create effective interfaces between humans and technology.

46DB5E00EEDF471996519A0FF0B17FB3.description: Determine and document the requirements and alternative solutions to fulfill the customers' needs.

A95727E39AF5424A8AA19A9F6D6C4735.description: Develop strategies that target the specific needs and desires of the customer.

E0FB7FB927CB41EB9B1C467E186E5E37.description: Recognize and prevent unintended consequences of development work: programming errors, security issues, health and environmental risks, and privacy concerns.

6552887EDE4C4C9CACF5EDEFEA9D19A3.description: Describe the major purposes and benefits of development, including automation, improving productivity, modeling and analysis, and entertainment.

5F7A1A864BE84CA4BF58B198A19C5917.description: Define and analyze systems and software requirements.

E8BAF3A8213A453482657791FA0806F2.description: Diagram processes using flowcharts and the Unified Modeling Language.

6BF0E8DE4F3740C2ADA374BDEA28D5A8.description: Track development project milestones using the concept of versions.

E803FB113BE2466E9B670D834C721C97.description: Work as a member of, and within the scope and boundaries of, a development project team.

44AFD8125767483687AC3E11BD0921C4.description: Identify and describe how specifications and requirements are developed for new and existing software applications.

E3E6B1DE813A46A0B420C38730DA1367.description: Identify and describe models of systems development, systems development life cycle (SDLC), and agile computing.

1D2C45FEEB7D4E0AB4A9BC2002B0798F.description: Identify the phases of the systems development life cycle, including analysis, design, programming, testing, implementation, maintenance, and improvement.

F9167CF0BB094584830D28CCDE13F6A4.description: Identify and apply the systems development process.

comments: Students in the Software and Systems Development pathway prepare for careers related to computer science that involve the design, development, implementation, maintenance, and management of systems that rely on software programs to satisfy the operational needs of modern business organizations. Persons with expertise in systems development and programming are critical to support operations like electronic commerce, medical records management, retail sales and inventory management, digital entertainment, and use of energy.

4E39B48DCDF64827A4A205CE1C19ABB8.description: Identify and apply common techniques for disaster prevention and recovery.

0E0D65CECC42495ABAD03733B1D97843.description: Identify common potential risks and entrance points, including internal and external risks, and the tools used to neutralize them: firewalls; monitoring; and antivirus, spyware, and spam protection.

841FE09F13074251937A4DB43AC738F2.description: List the policies and procedures for routine administration, such as user agreement, incident reporting, and recovery for users.

D44F4429A9AE474CB8A15A0ED8B3CB1B.description: Describe the importance of classifying appropriate monitoring devices and procedures for quick identification and prevention of security violations.

0373D0468A7544288D5A024BD5342895.description: Identify and define command network security threats: hackers, crackers, viruses, worms, and Trojan horses.

8D0350BD8A1E43A2B98DC6EF1B609C77.description: Identify security threats to a network and describe general methods to mitigate those threats.

F30F042C2E694F8BA81E4E056E30F275.description: Evaluate, create, and process voice, video, and data transmissions.

6959B5B55FFD42DF8252C40563E5EE9C.description: Evaluate emerging products, services, and business models in relation to the creation, setup, and management of networks that support information and communication technologies.

279FBDEEC01A472F89EB0AE280FE95F0.description: Diagram physical and logical layouts of networks that support information and communication technologies.

6F50FB5703CD47EEBDC95A7B65591619.description: Describe the effective management of human, financial, and communications resources from the standpoints of the user and the provider.

E1999E4AB7464723A339C549250C9887.description: Analyze a customer's organizational needs and requirements to identify networking needs.

BD988E95EA064D2D9DAF50CD60AB7EED.description: Configure compatible systems across various platforms and types of media.

520D5F12482D4004AC352F2089A25721.description: Evaluate the features of communications software products in terms of their appropriateness to organizational tasks.

DC99EE6953844D968C4E7774C2121893.description: Identify and document the appropriate uses of networking services, products, and applications.

7F13E53ECE3545F89DB7C08EF0ACAE10.description: Use and assess network communication applications and infrastructure.

8D9315BBEFBA4B83AE3D32B703EC81AB.description: Interpret, organize, and communicate complex network diagrams by using information collected from detailed drawings.

C447729B0BFE4436BD9957A1810CF8B8.description: Classify and use various electronic components, symbols, abbreviations, and media common to network topology diagrams.

68BA317DBB9242B1B7C55E8487B9B9A9.description: Demonstrate how to communicate and interpret information clearly in industry-standard visual and written formats.

4992FEE14938400E866E662D30BB590B.description: Analyze network system interdependencies and constraints.

E6D23EB21DFC409081764A77C287F674.description: Use project management skills and tools for managing and maintaining various types of networks.

B580418BCF374EDB986D1116B0292DC7.description: Apply known effective methods of disseminating information and instruction to users.

403F8167ADEF48CF907ECAD5FC8ED5B4.description: Use common help-desk tools and resources, such as incident tracking, knowledge database, and staffing to administer and manage a network.

26D56580615841A5A03FAB7A90114F41.description: Apply the proper security patches, updates, and procedures necessary to maintain and support a network.

5EA82E37850E4FC1A0FBA19F3BE099BF.description: Apply appropriate technologies to improve network performance for data, voice, and video transmission.

0F059FF70CE946568533A98BBA0411E4.description: Identify the implications of major protocols and international standards and their impact on network management.

86594DBE0A534631B5AA5B0F8CEEE850.description: Identify common customer policies and procedures, including those for management of incidents.

EDFEBA5826DB42B18BAC309316042311.description: Identify and use network tools to troubleshoot and verify network availability and performance.

95F8ADFBA0C642B7B2DCB4D8DB46595F.description: Demonstrate proper network administration and management skills.

FF5BFF201FC241F4B1DA46AD29DFBA44.description: Evaluate, select, and deploy a variety of network architectures, information and communication technologies, and protocols.

7CB002A95C774C20A110A16A1FF1FADC.description: Implement a functional wired and wireless network, including the installation and configuration of components, software, and plug-ins.

797DD5F17DE245C09EC7652C46A744F5.description: Configure the major addressing and routing protocols used in networking.

94C9F8DABAC6457DBDF1E2EDD0B69695.description: Confirm operating parameters, apply test procedures, make necessary adjustments, and assemble the components of a network system or subsystem.

A0F1DD181D2B44308BC1911F20C93220.description: Distinguish between the topologies and protocols of local area networks and those of wide area networks.

FE1736479A534FF7995BA19F2696B8CF.description: Describe the differences between various network environments: peer-to-peer, client-server, thin client, virtualized, internetworks, intranets, and extranets.

60623E204D014950AC42DF3E745EEC51.description: Identify and describe the functions of various network devices, including network connectivity hardware.

E7FCE4125E184333858C6823F1D3CCF8.description: Install, configure, and differentiate between common network devices.

B2191ACF4C784FF6A9166E25378DE443.description: Test and maintain wired and wireless network communications components and systems.

BFAF66CDDA444C2E99CE13BF9FD81B44.description: Demonstrate standard procedures and practices for safely using tools and working safely around the electrical environment in various networking systems.

EBA82DE1E4644D108F9BBFEEAB9E429E.description: Use appropriate wiring and wireless standards and plan, install, and maintain media (copper, fiber, and wireless) for a variety of network systems.

92E1A6A9D1264914B592A02A0D8E151D.description: Identify, describe, and implement network media and physical topologies.

098AA873713E448B8BAA18FA5ACDD82E.description: Design and document data/communication systems networks.

95E95381548E48A1ADF8102E705B4A76.description: Explain the characteristics of networking hardware and applications and the methods to deploy them.

568CF53EF8EF49CC802CD84189EDDB2F.description: Identify and explain how data, voice, and video/communications are carried through the most common network media.

6C0E4DC1A2EE4117A9DA467A08D57BFD.description: List the fundamental elements of the major networking models established by the industry standards of recognized organizations: the Open System Interconnect (OSI) or transmission-control/Internet protocol (TCP/IP) models.

0EF084C80B02421AA4B247484834342D.description: Define the terminology used in the design, assembly, configuration, and implementation of networks.

87EF0B34E20248CBAF5B73EBD95B189C.description: Identify and describe the principles of networking and the technologies, models, and protocols used in a network.

comments: Students in the Networking pathway prepare for careers that involve network analysis, planning, and implementation, including the design, installation, maintenance, and management of network systems. The successful establishment, maintenance, and securing of information and communication technologies infrastructure is critical to the success of every twenty-first-century organization. Employment continues to grow for persons with expertise in networking.

A730DD85E7824A52AC78A5FC7D2F9451.description: Use a systematic method of continual improvement; plan, do, check, act (PDCA), total quality (TQ), or Six Sigma.

6C3A5F46F85E4B90903128439D8478A9.description: Design, develop, implement, and monitor a project by creating and integrating technologies.

44B8C29AD67240D19C20F0D7558845BA.description: Analyze business problems by using functional and cost-benefit perspectives.

41969365F33847CDA4F33E4970A4001C.description: Develop the purpose and scope of a project.

109AF71A274F4577912F285751015E02.description: Manage and implement information, technology, and communication projects.

AC63E5BC0BE04B75AFEE29C4914DDF68.description: Document technical support provided such as using a ticketing system.

46B05FE2C9F5411D84DEBF42F1AE3DA6.description: Use technical writing and communication skills to work effectively with diverse groups of people, including users with less technical abilities.

B978F3C98AE2468B8014F5D794A8FB3B.description: Recognize the scope of duties ICT support staff have and tiered levels of support.

4A33F1A72F1C4B06A28C51A02A602FAE.description: Support and train users on various software, hardware, and network systems.

0C9C6BCB4E364C559264D9AA1910648A.description: Evaluate support needs for different data and systems configurations.

AA631CEA4BB746BAB907E14955CE2F80.description: Use specific problem solving strategies appropriate to troubleshooting, eliminating possibilities, or guess and check.

29D45F262C1D47DD880A7CC4CE2504F5.description: Use a logical and structured approach to isolate and identify the source of problems and to resolve problems.

69355270F4774707BE380940EE8904F7.description: Diagnose and solve software, hardware, networking, and security problems.

5DDB956379004FD2A39DA24529CFF2A4.description: Take preventative measures to reduce security risks (e.g., strong passwords, avoid social engineering ploys, limit account permissions).

6286B9F7916B44D691C92205F0F785E9.description: Identify potential attack vectors and security threats.

D45CB33FF0B84AF1AC3CE6A02CCBF68C.description: Follow laws, regulatory guidelines, policies, and procedures to ensure the security and integrity of information systems.

DF5958DBE4C84546A201A55B10E81CE6.description: Identify requirements for maintaining secure network systems.

C25291D1D341497BBF544BCABF014497.description: Evaluate the systems-development life cycle and develop appropriate plans to maintain a given system after assessing its impact on resources and total cost of ownership (TCO).

C7B699125E66450188B653CFBF05B27D.description: Automate common tasks using macros or scripting.

75A2D03022DC4D35B2FCED962DBA2F7B.description: Use different systems and associated utilities to perform such functions as file management, backup and recovery, and execution of programs.

834320660FC442688A2074D57A83C0CB.description: Administer and maintain software and systems.

1D85250616F04D99855B4EBFA717F802.description: Describe and contrast the differences between various Internet protocols: hypertext transfer protocol (http), hypertext transfer protocol secure (https), file transfer protocol (ftp), simple mail transfer protocol (smtp).

1CA7515733604539A05CDB7B7E6FE963.description: Use multiple online search techniques and resources to acquire information.

5E8784C2091746D2B178021BBF15ECE1.description: Identify and describe the layered nature of computing and networking such as the Open Systems Interconnect (OSI) model.

9D97D6AFC508449B9ABE25C442D924D7.description: Recognize where processes are running in a networked environment (e.g., client access, remote access).

282D8B587FB4457FB00CC570E355D0ED.description: Identify and apply multiple ways to transfer information and resources (e.g., text, data, audio, video, still images) between software programs and systems.

0DB49CD0923F43E090CF4ECF87518332.description: Access and transmit information in a networked environment.

CF644A024D04461B921B521259DFD252.description: Define and use appropriate naming conventions and file management strategies.

A6BBCED7A716438E949B89FB2852BFDA.description: Investigate, evaluate, select, and use major types of software, services, and vendors.

A22C66F1F95E4B3E9BF51D5D8C49E2BC.description: Identify and list the criteria and processes for evaluating the functions of information systems.

7EDD55B174BB4079B912A585E230AA26.description: Acquire, install, and implement software and systems.

AB5AD3A20E9B44DA8D47AC181CBA0D4A.description: Analyze and design business processes in a cycle of continual improvement.

2457F4548D5F4C1C8DA542E17ADA219C.description: Model business processes using tools such as organization charts, flowcharts, and timelines.

7AC66972C832494E8503A7DD3B9ABAC9.description: Identify common organizational, technical, and financial risks associated with the implementation and use of information and communication systems.

90055C693ED540918DBBC4AD3D969FFD.description: Describe how technology is integrated into business processes.

50BC1020D92842C086203DD91FE120D7.description: Describe the role of information and communication technologies in organizations.

comments: Students in the Information Support and Services pathway prepare for careers that involve the implementation of computer services and software, support of multimedia products and services, provision of technical assistance, creation of technical documentation, and the administration and management of information and communication systems. Mastery of information and communication technologies is the foundation for all successful business organizations today. Persons with expertise in information and communication technologies support and services are in high demand for a variety of positions in business and industry.

F1F3FC7324D4411EABF3890AC4A1D125.description: Create a portfolio, or similar collection of work, that offers evidence through assessment and evaluation of skills and knowledge competency as contained in the anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators.

72420E95AD704244A9F281B996F97FF3.description: Employ entrepreneurial practices and behaviors appropriate to Information and Communication Technologies sector opportunities.

DF0E92A19FB24CBF8037D0AE51171DC1.description: Demonstrate entrepreneurship skills and knowledge of self-employment options and innovative ventures.

8F1440AA879A4B5CBC955ECC87B4D509.description: Demonstrate proficiency in a career technical pathway that leads to certification, licensure, and/or continued learning at the postsecondary level.

79B04C18521D465A9563864F61412B9E.description: Utilize work-based/workplace learning experiences to demonstrate and expand upon knowledge and skills gained during classroom instruction and laboratory practices specific to the Information and Communication Technologies sector program of study.

comments: Demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills contained in the Information and Communication Technologies anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators in classroom, laboratory, and workplace settings, and through career technical student organizations such as Future Business Leaders of America and SkillsUSA.

4A9880573CC44BF79F9DDABF6495F65F.description: Analyze the effectiveness of online information resources to support collaborative tasks, research, publications, communications, and increased productivity.

F773F4C018574928A7967CBB5D103D54.description: Evaluate the accuracy, relevance, and comprehensiveness of retrieved information.

5BA3A2847BC048FF922874CC968539E7.description: Know appropriate search procedures for different types of information, sources, and queries.

AE584969FC704750886995AE27366D36.description: Know multiple ways in which to transfer information and resources (e.g., text, data, sound, video, still images) between software programs and systems.

208FFB73ECAF4DEB975E631BE16102B9.description: Manage files in a hierarchical system.

8CD0BF998A914CB28D44B37952A9E26C.description: Use common industry-standard software and their applications including word processing, spreadsheets, databases, and multimedia software.

E035C7266F05450F8B0704E0D6F6FD78.description: Understand security concepts including authorization, rights, and encryption.

BAB66A3C02E947A0BC4D8D6ADD1BD048.description: Understand the SI (metric) prefixes commonly used in computing including, at least, kilo, mega, giga, and tera.

542494EE547D41A4A14A244A6B07D407.description: Understand data sizes of various types of information (text, pictures, sound, video, etc.) and data capacity of various forms of media.

C85902A703344CFD91DBD648AD850077.description: Understand the major software and hardware components of a computer and a network and how they relate to each other.

C657D52F7C3B4802A6D667C123DFA72C.description: Collaborate with industry experts for specific technical knowledge and skills.

9076B42C09284046ABD4A25FF26FD36B.description: Construct projects and products specific to the Information and Communication Technologies sector requirements and expectations.

66AB282C0F21405386823A4BBB283E11.description: Comply with the rules, regulations, and expectations of all aspects of the Information and Communication Technologies sector.

A409408C47744DC19854B48EFF90113E.description: Interpret and explain terminology and practices specific to the Information and Communication Technologies sector.

comments: Apply essential technical knowledge and skills common to all pathways in the Information and Communication Technologies sector, following procedures when carrying out experiments or performing technical tasks.

DF527907C76A4DA893DA07B8FCC9F81F.description: Participate in interactive teamwork to solve real Information and Communication Technologies sector issues and problems.

53B4F063C0B04872AD26B7427843D588.description: Respect individual and cultural differences and recognize the importance of diversity in the workplace.

62E6AE4E58BB408A94F0AB796C5F3FF0.description: Understand that the modern world is an international community and requires an expanded global view.

356C4271348249BF851D42EED3B430B8.description: Explain how professional associations and organizations and associated leadership development and competitive career development activities enhance academic preparation, promote career choices, and contribute to employment opportunities.

F3B9761472DA427AB5956241B287A05D.description: Understand the characteristics and benefits of teamwork, leadership, and citizenship in the school, community, and workplace setting.

861D3DDB71A74554B968FCF7EE337363.description: Identify the characteristics of successful teams, including leadership, cooperation, collaboration, and effective decision-making skills as applied in groups, teams, and career technical student organization activities.

A18F0DF4C34C4A41B0630FAA35980C01.description: Define leadership and identify the responsibilities, competencies, and behaviors of successful leaders.

comments: Work with peers to promote divergent and creative perspectives, effective leadership, group dynamics, team and individual decision making, benefits of workforce diversity, and conflict resolution such as those practiced in the Future Business Leaders of America and SkillsUSA career technical student organization.

F893A4402B4445499337F2580FE18F77.description: Identify legal and ethical issues that have proliferated with increased technology adoption, including hacking, scamming, and breach of privacy.

C5EBA2C62F4D4E88A5D3665236A1ABCE.description: Conform to rules and regulations regarding sharing of confidential information, as determined by Information and Communication Technologies sector laws and practices.

EE7EA7658149472A87F1519D5B821D4B.description: Adhere to copyright and intellectual property laws and regulations, and use and appropriately cite proprietary information.

E10078311E614F75BE7A08F1588D7D10.description: Analyze organizational culture and practices within the workplace environment.

98A76DCBA54F4972BA74B1565DC027B9.description: Explain the importance of personal integrity, confidentiality, and ethical behavior in the workplace.

30C5DCE205784EF9AE27632AB49E4ED9.description: Demonstrate ethical and legal practices consistent with Information and Communication Technologies sector workplace standards.

D0371D203C1043F3BE76AD319E14F77A.description: Identify local, district, state, and federal regulatory agencies, entities, laws, and regulations related to the Information and Communication Technologies industry sector.

7F73ABAC68C147E39FBC76632C281E8F.description: Access, analyze, and implement quality assurance standards of practice.

comments: Practice professional, ethical, and legal behavior, responding thoughtfully to diverse perspectives and resolving contradictions when possible, consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and organizational norms.

A10B843E35D34195A02F4572D4E5F766.description: Explore issues of global significance and document the impact on the Information and Communication Technologies sector.

7A5C73CBDA1C43D3952AB0E4095584FD.description: Demonstrate the qualities and behaviors that constitute a positive and professional work demeanor, including appropriate attire for the profession.

1E02A181B3C547C8BAAAB701BC1838CE.description: Demonstrate knowledge and practice of responsible financial management.

62F25A6BC72C48799C49C228B409DF31.description: Apply high-quality techniques to product or presentation design and development.

CC9AE44F58D0413D9DB0FB0A48348CE1.description: Practice time management and efficiency to fulfill responsibilities.

C407E348BF5E4BB48952E1CFA5EBD3A6.description: Understand the need to adapt to changing and varied roles and responsibilities.

0626291EF912408A80C277C15D42E93B.description: Explain the importance of accountability and responsibility in fulfilling personal, community, and workplace roles.

7E38DA89E2A54AA08E88ECF41A4822CA.description: Recognize how financial management impacts the economy, workforce, and community.

comments: Initiate, and participate in, a range of collaborations demonstrating behaviors that reflect personal and professional responsibility, flexibility, and respect in the Information and Communication Technologies sector workplace environment and community settings.

B62AC4D266D14748BC7C85A805667719.description: Conserve energy while computing (e.g., turn off equipment at night, power-saving settings, etc.)

D484B4E63E9B45F5AF15057A599E31CC.description: Act conscientiously regarding the use of natural resources (e.g., paper, ink, etc.)

F6D8E16B679C42FD8E07329AE982D351.description: Dispose of e-waste properly, understanding the health, environmental, and legal risks of improper disposal.

12794F9F4C784C3389834B949BE585DA.description: Maintain a safe and healthful working environment.

8040C6BFC8574C1CB11DE35612E74FF3.description: Be informed of laws/acts pertaining to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).

C27363A5E5E74E7384057F0B76425CFB.description: Maintain a safe and healthful working environment.

94E4A06CB5DA4A53A447FFD79F4C7FB6.description: Demonstrate how to prevent and respond to work-related accidents or injuries; this includes demonstrating an understanding of ergonomics.

FB631DDE96854E55B9ACE84633381A30.description: Practice personal safety when lifting, bending, or moving equipment and supplies.

35313A312ACA491EBBEA421355C97813.description: Use health and safety practices for storing, cleaning, and maintaining tools, equipment, and supplies.

23A4B7A9B52A4876972B8C454FE001EB.description: Interpret policies, procedures, and regulations for the workplace environment, including employer and employee responsibilities.

54312CDF7AF849E3A9651730FA2BDD28.description: Locate, and adhere to, Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) instructions.

comments: Demonstrate health and safety procedures, regulations, and personal health practices and determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific words and phrases as related to the Information and Communication Technologies sector workplace environment.

502D631CE8034BD482F7179BAA88C357.description: Apply the concepts of Boolean logic to decision making and searching.

E167F41346AC431F8DF18B02F84F2A74.description: Understand the concept of base systems, including binary and hexadecimal.

E7BAC8669F434093A5CEE5A7F28813FB.description: Deconstruct large problems into components to solve.

5469BBE7FBF94DBEB7DD04E4848BA04B.description: Create and use algorithms and solve problems.

C01243A814824F53B48EB6F82E97C735.description: Work out problems iteratively and recursively.

8BCC798315E34A89A1A72F53737BA066.description: Know the available resources for identifying and resolving problems.

392970D029924BA7BA7F5513414AD85F.description: Use a logical and structured approach to isolate and identify the source of problems and to resolve problems.

8BCEB3AA67814D899624EB2C577FBCC2.description: Interpret information and draw conclusions, based on the best analysis, to make informed decisions.

2DD870A3FF0540668AF984C02FA0AB70.description: Use systems thinking to analyze how various components interact with each other to produce outcomes in a complex work environment.

F38469396A9A4CC7B9CE5FE7FD4382B1.description: Solve predictable and unpredictable work-related problems using various types of reasoning (inductive, deductive) as appropriate.

7F59DAC006EF4F2E80723982B611F379.description: Identify and ask significant questions that clarify various points of view to solve problems.

comments: Conduct short, as well as more sustained, research to create alternative solutions to answer a question or solve a problem unique to the Information and Communication Technologies sector using critical and creative thinking, logical reasoning, analysis, inquiry, and problem-solving techniques.

454FB58D7AF243F0BBC6B616EBCB18C9.description: Assess the value of various information and communication technologies to interact with constituent populations as part of a search of the current literature or in relation to the information task.

19C300E5EA724DE48FFA2CFFE50AE4F1.description: Research past, present, and projected technological advances as they impact a particular pathway.

CEC79732142546FAA69FBF342F016BBD.description: Discern the quality and value of information collected using digital technologies, and recognize bias and intent of the associated sources.

9234FED520A54D919B16FA55C0714A2D.description: Use information and communication technologies to synthesize, summarize, compare, and contrast information from multiple sources.

21893FE88EE5426DBD90D3A095FE013A.description: Employ technology based communications responsibly and effectively to explore complex systems and issues.

369731CFD6C241A0A15FDE83A748C241.description: Use electronic reference materials to gather information and produce products and services.

comments: Use existing and emerging technology, to investigate, research, and produce products and services, including new information, as required in the Information and Communication Technologies sector workplace environment.

C750FE22A2254ABCACF1BEDA9FE02622.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and postsecondary options.

7059433AE6454F92BEBA4B493EABE488.description: Understand how digital media are used by potential employers and postsecondary agencies to evaluate candidates.

9D21573B8EDC4ED596DE193F2E974BA5.description: Recognize the importance of small business in the California and global economies.

D5A21EF1E59043ADBF6220DBF0ED890A.description: Recognize the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor in a productive society.

CAD14F8EBB914D499A5C6A74B2A64F55.description: Integrate changing employment trends, societal needs, and economic conditions into career planning.

54E1A5BC37204580B15E68A77C6BB8A0.description: Research the scope of career opportunities available and the requirements for education, training, certification, and licensure.

F9419F7E65C64F0CA2246E73EAEC332F.description: Explore how information and communication technologies are used in career planning and decision making.

8AB883EEB08B4236997D5717AB015482.description: Evaluate personal character traits such as trust, respect, and responsibility and understand the impact they can have on career success.

30C29139E7E74BA789FA5C38B2F83E78.description: Identify personal interests, aptitudes, information, and skills necessary for informed career decision making.

comments: Integrate multiple sources of career information from diverse formats to make informed career decisions, solve problems, and manage personal career plans.

0579EB1D33EB4A7E836AA52962558E80.description: Understand the principles of a customer-oriented service approach to users.

70CC9C2F313F4972A1FDFFC4A1BF0536.description: Use technical writing and communication skills to work effectively with diverse groups of people.

689A75C8CC18490B90176CBA22EA11A6.description: Advocate and practice safe, legal, and responsible use of digital media information and communications technologies.

814ABA6721EC40AFA1041776126A5F85.description: Communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using a variety of media and formats.

C9895ABD95E3451AB36666DBBAB87796.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication such as accurate spelling, grammar, and format.

1490F1AAE78C45F99FEE0AFA41DB5BB9.description: Interpret verbal and nonverbal communications and respond appropriately.

B329C2B7177C46E090BCFD67BB72AC55.description: Identify barriers to accurate and appropriate communication.

8C80344A55F84681A7296461885C4B07.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a senderreceiver model.

comments: Acquire and accurately use Information and Communication Technologies sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Information and Communication Technologies academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
